title: China grants medical equipment to Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Barbados in 2018 (linked to project ID #63992)
description: On February 13, 2018, during the second Chinese medical team's visit to Barbados, a handover ceremony occurred for a grant of medical supplies from the Chinese government to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH). In his speech at the event, Ambassador Yan Xiusheng recognized the Chinese medical teams that previously provided assistance to the hospital (see projects #54835, #54834, #71321, and #54836). The grant included both medical equipment and consumables. It is valued at USD $200,000.  In 2016, China donated hospital heart monitors to the hospital (project ID #71832). In 2017, China also granted USD $200,000 to QEH (project #63992).
staff_comments: Barbados is not ODA-eligible from 2011 onwards. Transaction amount is calculated by subtracting 400,000 USD - 200,000 USD, as sources report the two grants of medical equipment combined (referring to the grants captured in this project and project #63992) were worth a total of 400,000 USD, and the grant in project #63992 was worth approximately 200,000 USD.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China grants medical equipment to Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Barbados in 2018 (linked to project ID #63992)

# Description
On February 13, 2018, during the second Chinese medical team's visit to Barbados, a handover ceremony occurred for a grant of medical supplies from the Chinese government to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH). In his speech at the event, Ambassador Yan Xiusheng recognized the Chinese medical teams that previously provided assistance to the hospital (see projects #54835, #54834, #71321, and #54836). The grant included both medical equipment and consumables. It is valued at USD $200,000.  In 2016, China donated hospital heart monitors to the hospital (project ID #71832). In 2017, China also granted USD $200,000 to QEH (project #63992).
justification: Project involves donation of medical equipment and supplies, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Grant of medical equipment and consumables to hospital, healthcare sector focus

title: 2018 Chinese Ambassador Scholarship Award granted to Barbadian students (linked to #71825, #72094)
description: On November 23, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados held the 2018 "Chinese Ambassador Scholarship" award ceremony. About 50 attendees were present. Five students studying the Chinese language at the University of the West Indies, Cave Hill Campus won the award, which is intended to recognize top Chinese language learners at the university, further the study of the Chinese language, and deepen the educational cooperation between China and Barbados.   The first of these scholarships was granted to students on October 21, 2016 (see project ID #71825). The 2017 award is captured by project ID #72094.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
2018 Chinese Ambassador Scholarship Award granted to Barbadian students (linked to #71825, #72094)

# Description
On November 23, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados held the 2018 "Chinese Ambassador Scholarship" award ceremony. About 50 attendees were present. Five students studying the Chinese language at the University of the West Indies, Cave Hill Campus won the award, which is intended to recognize top Chinese language learners at the university, further the study of the Chinese language, and deepen the educational cooperation between China and Barbados.   The first of these scholarships was granted to students on October 21, 2016 (see project ID #71825). The 2017 award is captured by project ID #72094.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for Chinese language study, educational cooperation focus

title: Second Chinese medical expert team extends service at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Barbados (linked to #54835, #54834, #71321, and #54836)
description: On July 18, 2018, the First Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing Medical University and the Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH) in Barbados signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), to extend the stay of the second Chinese medical team sent to assist QEH. Two surgeons and one physician from the second batch of medical professionals (see project ID #54835 for the original project capturing this second batch) remained at QEH for an additional five days, between July 18 and July 23, 2018, to provide free medical services to Barbadians. The Chongqing Municipal Health Commission under the Chongqing Medical University organized the extension. Assistance provided included orthopedic and vascular operations. which initiated a five day event in which free medical services were provided to Barbadians.  In total, China sent four batches of medical experts to assist QEH. These missions are captured by projects ID ##54835, #54834, #71321, and #54836. The grant included both medical equipment and consumables valued at USD $200,000. China donated hospital heart monitors to the hospital in 2016 (project ID #71832) and other medical equipment in 2018 (project ID #71973). In 2017, China also granted USD $200,000 to QEH (project #63992)
staff_comments: Barbados is not ODA-eligible from 2011 onwards.
combined_text:

Two surgeons and one physician from the second batch of medical professionals (see project ID #54835 for the original project capturing this second batch) remained at QEH for an additional five days, between July 18 and July 23, 2018, to provide free medical services to Barbadians. The Chongqing Municipal Health Commission under the Chongqing Medical University organized the extension. Assistance provided included orthopedic and vascular operations. which initiated a five day event in which free medical services were provided to Barbadians.  In total, China sent four batches of medical experts to assist QEH. These missions are captured by projects ID ##54835, #54834, #71321, and #54836. The grant included both medical equipment and consumables valued at USD $200,000. China donated hospital heart monitors to the hospital in 2016 (project ID #71832) and other medical equipment in 2018 (project ID #71973). In 2017, China also granted USD $200,000 to QEH (project #63992)
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services and medical assistance without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical expert team providing free services, donation of medical equipment, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy grants 150 tablets to underprivileged children in Barbados
description: On October 13, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados granted over 150 tablets to underprivileged children in Barbados. The grant was facilitated through the Eden Lodge Youth Charitable Trust, a local organization, and is intended for education, communication, and leisure. The handover ceremony took place at the Courtyard Marriott Hotel.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy grants 150 tablets to underprivileged children in Barbados

# Description
On October 13, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados granted over 150 tablets to underprivileged children in Barbados. The grant was facilitated through the Eden Lodge Youth Charitable Trust, a local organization, and is intended for education, communication, and leisure. The handover ceremony took place at the Courtyard Marriott Hotel.
justification: Project focuses on education and social welfare without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Tablet grants for underprivileged children, education and communication focus

title: Chinese Embassy in Barbados hosts reception to welcome ambassador and celebrate Chinese New Year in 2018(linked to #72995)
description: On February 23, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados held a reception at Accra Beach Resort and Spa to celebrate both the arrival of Ambassador Yan Xiusheng in Barbados and the 2018 Chinese New Year. About 200 people attended the reception, including Barbadian government officials, Chinese citizens living abroad, representatives of Chinese-funded enterprises, the Chinese Medical Team, representatives from the Confucius Institute at the University of the West Indies' (UWI's) Cave Hill Campus, and members of the Barbadian public from various industries and careers. The reception was intended to further promote cooperation between the China and Barbados.  Activities included educational presentations from the Confucius Institute about Chinese calligraphy, tea art, paper cutting, and dumpling making, as well as the showing of the promotional videos and pictures about the One Belt One Road initiative and Chinese New Year and performances from the "Beautiful Tianjin" Art Troupe (“美丽天津”艺术团).   This project was part of the fourth Fish and Dragon Festival, from February 22 and 24, 2018, to commemorate the Chinese New Year (project ID #72995).
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Barbados hosts reception to welcome ambassador and celebrate Chinese New Year in 2018(linked to #72995)

# Description
On February 23, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados held a reception at Accra Beach Resort and Spa to celebrate both the arrival of Ambassador Yan Xiusheng in Barbados and the 2018 Chinese New Year. About 200 people attended the reception, including Barbadian government officials, Chinese citizens living abroad, representatives of Chinese-funded enterprises, the Chinese Medical Team, representatives from the Confucius Institute at the University of the West Indies' (UWI's) Cave Hill Campus, and members of the Barbadian public from various industries and careers. The reception was intended to further promote cooperation between the China and Barbados.  Activities included educational presentations from the Confucius Institute about Chinese calligraphy, tea art, paper cutting, and dumpling making, as well as the showing of the promotional videos and pictures about the One Belt One Road initiative and Chinese New Year and performances from the "Beautiful Tianjin" Art Troupe (“美丽天津”艺术团).   This project was part of the fourth Fish and Dragon Festival, from February 22 and 24, 2018, to commemorate the Chinese New Year (project ID #72995).
justification: Cultural and diplomatic event without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Reception event focused on cultural exchange, diplomatic relations, and Chinese New Year celebration

title: Barbadian Training on various subjects provided under China Aid Training Program (Linked to #72182)
description: In 2018 and 2019, a group of trainees from Barbados visited China under China Aid Traning Program for training course on economic development, cultural protection, new energy technologies, environmental governance and tropical island economies. Exactly how many people attended this specific training is unclear, but over the six training courses offered through the "China Aid Human Resource" program from 2018 to 2019, over 120 officials and technicians participated. (Other 2018/19 training courses can be found at #72182.) China Aid Training Program provided aided training of human resources, including short-term training programs and degree programs, covering various fields of economy, management, finance, IT, agriculture, medicine, education, etc.  On January 10, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados hosted a reception to recognize participants of the program. Over 130 attendees were present at the event.  See "2019 China Aid Human Resource Training Schedule" for multilateral courses that could potentially be that referred to in this project.
staff_comments: Barbados was not ODA-eligible in 2018 or 2019.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Barbadian Training on various subjects provided under China Aid Training Program (Linked to #72182)

# Description
In 2018 and 2019, a group of trainees from Barbados visited China under China Aid Traning Program for training course on economic development, cultural protection, new energy technologies, environmental governance and tropical island economies. Exactly how many people attended this specific training is unclear, but over the six training courses offered through the "China Aid Human Resource" program from 2018 to 2019, over 120 officials and technicians participated. (Other 2018/19 training courses can be found at #72182.) China Aid Training Program provided aided training of human resources, including short-term training programs and degree programs, covering various fields of economy, management, finance, IT, agriculture, medicine, education, etc.  On January 10, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Barbados hosted a reception to recognize participants of the program. Over 130 attendees were present at the event.  See "2019 China Aid Human Resource Training Schedule" for multilateral courses that could potentially be that referred to in this project.
justification: Training program covering various subjects without clear environmental or energy transition focus
evidence: Training on economic development, cultural protection, environmental governance, and other non-energy specific topics

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 692 million grant— via ETCA — for Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#90334)
description: On April 25, 2019, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Belarusian President Lukashenko unveiled a model of the Belarusian National Football Stadium and Swimming Pool Project. Then, on August 6, 2019, Belarusian Economy Minister Dmitry Krutoi announced that the Chinese Government would provide a $235 million grant for the construction of a national football stadium and world-class swimming pool in Minsk.   One week later, on August 13, 2019, the President of Belarus signed Decree 306 for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium [Национальный олимпийский стадион ”Динамо“], and Decree 307 for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports [Республиканский центр олимпийской подготовки по водным видам спорта]. The RMB 692 million grant commitment from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is captured via Project ID#66089, while the RMB 576 million grant commitment from MOFCOM for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is captured via Project ID#90334.   The grant funding was drawn from multiple Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) that the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus had previously signed. One of these ETCAs was signed on June 10, 2018 and it committed RMB 800 million for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project, the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project, and other projects. Another ETCA was signed on October 10, 2018. It committed an unknown amount of grant grant funding for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project and the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project.   The purpose of the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is to construct a stadium with 33,000 seats in the capital city of Minsk. The design and construction of the stadium is meant to comply with the prevailing standards of international football federations (FIFA and UEFA). The project site is located on on Vaneyeva Street next to the existing Traktor Stadium and it occupies an area of 12.43 hectares and a building area of 48,000 square meters.   Beijing Urban Construction Group (BUCG) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. A consortium consisting of China International Engineering Corporation (IPPR), a subsidiary of CAMCE, and its affiliated Jingxing International Engineering Management Co. are responsible for project design and management. MOFCOM awarded BUCG an RMB 692 million project implementation contract on May 15, 2020.   Three days later, on May 18, 2020, the the Agency for International Economic Cooperation (AIECO) of China’s Ministry of Commerce convened a kick-off meeting for the project. A formal project commencement ceremony took place on June 30, 2020. On June 1, 2022, a Chinese subcontractor loaded into a Chinese port a set of prefabricated stand molds for the stadium in Belarus. The project was originally expected to commence on June 28, 2020 and reach completion by December 31, 2023.
staff_comments: 1. Many sources identify a single $235 million grant commitment to build both facilities while others list the total grant commitment as $180 million. AidData has used the monetary values of the MOFCOM contracts that were issued for these projects and coded the Project ID#90334 and Project ID#66089 accordingly. 2. These two facilities are also located in different areas of Minsk, despite initial plans for them to be attached. 3. This project is also known as the National Football Stadium Construction Project. The Russian project title is ациональный олимпийский стадион ”Динамо“. The Chinese project title is 白俄罗斯国家足球体育场项目
combined_text:

OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title

One week later, on August 13, 2019, the President of Belarus signed Decree 306 for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium [Национальный олимпийский стадион ”Динамо“], and Decree 307 for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports [Республиканский центр олимпийской подготовки по водным видам спорта]. The RMB 692 million grant commitment from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is captured via Project ID#66089, while the RMB 576 million grant commitment from MOFCOM for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is captured via Project ID#90334. One of these ETCAs was signed on June 10, 2018 and it committed RMB 800 million for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project, the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project, and other projects. It committed an unknown amount of grant grant funding for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project and the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project.   The purpose of the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is to construct a stadium with 33,000 seats in the capital city of Minsk. The design and construction of the stadium is meant to comply with the prevailing standards of international football federations (FIFA and UEFA). The project site is located on on Vaneyeva Street next to the existing Traktor Stadium and it occupies an area of 12.43 hectares and a building area of 48,000 square meters.   Beijing Urban Construction Group (BUCG) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. A consortium consisting of China International Engineering Corporation (IPPR), a subsidiary of CAMCE, and its affiliated Jingxing International Engineering Management Co. are responsible for project design and management. MOFCOM awarded BUCG an RMB 692 million project implementation contract on May 15, 2020.   Three days later, on May 18, 2020, the the Agency for International Economic Cooperation (AIECO) of China’s Ministry of Commerce convened a kick-off meeting for the project. justification: Project is focused on sports infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of national football stadium and swimming pool, primarily for sports and social development purposes

title: Chinese Government provides grant to Belarus for construction of China-Belarus Traditional Chinese Medicine Center
description: In May 2015, during a state visit to Belarus, Chinese President Xi Jinping pledged to construct a traditional Chinese medical center in Belarus. In 2018, an agreement was officially signed to establish a traditional medicine center at Minsk State Hospital in Belarus. The monetary value of this grant is unknown.  Zhejiang Chinese Medicine University Affiliated No.3 Hospital helped implemented the project. The medical center was completed on November 3, 2019, and includes acupuncture among other forms of traditional Chinese medical practice. This center is intended for strengthening the cultural ties between the two countries. The source from the Chinese official agency stated that the project serves as a representation of Chinese culture.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant to Belarus for construction of China-Belarus Traditional Chinese Medicine Center

# Description
In May 2015, during a state visit to Belarus, Chinese President Xi Jinping pledged to construct a traditional Chinese medical center in Belarus. In 2018, an agreement was officially signed to establish a traditional medicine center at Minsk State Hospital in Belarus. The monetary value of this grant is unknown.  Zhejiang Chinese Medicine University Affiliated No.3 Hospital helped implemented the project. The medical center was completed on November 3, 2019, and includes acupuncture among other forms of traditional Chinese medical practice. This center is intended for strengthening the cultural ties between the two countries. The source from the Chinese official agency stated that the project serves as a representation of Chinese culture.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Traditional Chinese Medicine Center, healthcare facility, cultural ties focus

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 127.17 million grant — via ETCA — for Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#66959, ID#66961, ID#66067, #66492)
description: On May 15, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus signed an exchange of letters, which committed up to RMB 127.17 million of grant funding for the Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project. This project was funded with the proceeds from an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) that the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus signed on September 29, 2016 (see Project ID #88735).   The purpose of the project was to construct 156 apartments inside the China-Belarus Industrial Park in an area that occupies 13,500 square meters. The intended beneficiaries of the apartments were employees of the Great Stone Industrial Park (also known as the China-Belarus Industrial Park or Індустрыяльны парк «Вялікі камень» or Индустриальный парк «Великий камень»), which is located in the Smolevichi district between the Petrovichi reservoir and Minsk National Airport (25 km to the east of the capital city of Minsk). The 1-bedroom, 2-bedroom, and 3-bedroom apartments were equipped with furniture and household appliance and all of the infrastructure facilities were located on the ground floor. The apartment buildings were designed with a reinforced concrete monolith frame and balconies with panoramic windows. To provide easy access to the apartment complex, a new road was constructed. The project also involved the installation of a unique heating and hot water supply system based on geothermal sources.   China Railway 25th Bureau Group Co Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on November 21, 2018 and the project was completed on August 27, 2019.  China Development Bank provided a $110 million USD loan (captured in linked ProjectID#66959), China Eximbank provided a $170 million USD PBC loan (captured in linked ProjectID#66961), and the Chinese Government had earlier provided RMB 90 million (captured in linked ProjectID#66067) all in support of the Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project.  This project was part of Phase 2 of Social Housing Project (as captured in #66492).
staff_comments: The Russian project title is Строительство жилого арендного комплекса на территории Китайско-Белорусского индустриального парка. The Chinese project title is 援白俄罗斯中白工业园宿舍楼项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 127.17 million grant — via ETCA — for Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#66959, ID#66961, ID#66067, #66492)

# Description
On May 15, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus signed an exchange of letters, which committed up to RMB 127.17 million of grant funding for the Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project. This project was funded with the proceeds from an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) that the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus signed on September 29, 2016 (see Project ID #88735).   The purpose of the project was to construct 156 apartments inside the China-Belarus Industrial Park in an area that occupies 13,500 square meters. The intended beneficiaries of the apartments were employees of the Great Stone Industrial Park (also known as the China-Belarus Industrial Park or Індустрыяльны парк «Вялікі камень» or Индустриальный парк «Великий камень»), which is located in the Smolevichi district between the Petrovichi reservoir and Minsk National Airport (25 km to the east of the capital city of Minsk). The 1-bedroom, 2-bedroom, and 3-bedroom apartments were equipped with furniture and household appliance and all of the infrastructure facilities were located on the ground floor. The apartment buildings were designed with a reinforced concrete monolith frame and balconies with panoramic windows. To provide easy access to the apartment complex, a new road was constructed. The project also involved the installation of a unique heating and hot water supply system based on geothermal sources.   China Railway 25th Bureau Group Co Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on November 21, 2018 and the project was completed on August 27, 2019.  China Development Bank provided a $110 million USD loan (captured in linked ProjectID#66959), China Eximbank provided a $170 million USD PBC loan (captured in linked ProjectID#66961), and the Chinese Government had earlier provided RMB 90 million (captured in linked ProjectID#66067) all in support of the Great Stone Industrial Park Apartment Construction Project.  This project was part of Phase 2 of Social Housing Project (as captured in #66492).
justification: Project primarily involves construction of residential apartments for industrial park employees, with social development focus
evidence: Construction of 156 apartments, social housing project, residential infrastructure development

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project (Linked to Project ID#66526 and #67382)
description: On February 11, 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China and Belagroprombank — a state-owned bank in Belarus — signed two loan agreements for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project: an RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 36 TOTAL NO. (641)] and a $50 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement. The GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66525, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. The borrowing terms of the BCL, which is captured via Project ID#67382, are unknown. Then, on June 11, 2018, China Eximbank and Belagroprombank signed an RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 37 TOTAL NO. (642)] for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. The second GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66526, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. Belagroprombank on-lent the proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL to a special purpose vehicle (SPV) called CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC). The proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL were to be used by the ultimate borrower, BNBC, to finance a three-year, $853.19 million (RMB 4.29 billion) engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract between CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC, which was signed on November 26, 2016. The loans appears to be secured by (i.e. collateralized against) cash deposits in escrow accounts (or so-called ‘special accounts’). In November 2021, the Government of Belarus transferred responsibility for the  'special accounts' from Belagroprombank to Belarusbank. The project involved the construction of a new amino acid plant, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant, a grain silo project with drying facilities, a combined heat and power station, and supporting infrastructure (such as railways, highways, natural gas pipelines, and transmission lines) in Pukhovichi District within Minsk Oblast. Upon completion, the agro-industrial complex is expected to process 250,000 tons of grain (wheat/triticale) per year and produce 64,700 tons of lysine, 5,900 tons of L-threonine, 1,300 tons of L-tryptophan, 23,000 tons of gluten, 99,000 tons of lysine-containing feed, 15,000 tons of ammonium sulfate crystals, and 10,000 tons of liquid ammonium sulfate. The project was also expected meet the future needs of cattle breeders for ‘essential amino acids.’ Its products will be sold domestically and abroad. CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on July 27, 2018 and was originally expected to last for 36 months (estimated end date: July 27, 2021). On March 26, 2019, a formal groundbreaking ceremony for the Belarusian agro-industrial complex project took place. By end of 2020, the project had achieved a 73% completion rate. On October 31, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  produced the first batch of lysine sulfate. Then, on November 8, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of first wheat gluten. Then, on December 21, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of threonine. The construction of all Phase 1 and Phase 2 facilities was completed in December 2021 and all facilities were put into operation in November 2022. On August 6, 2020, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a $547 million (RMB 3.8 billion) general EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. A Phase 3 feasibility study was subsequently completed and Phase 2 was approved by a Government of Belarus Commission for Foreign Exchange and Credit. Then, on November 5, 2021,  CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a revised EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project worth RMB 4.8 billion. Yang Jianqiang, Deputy President of CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  and Danil Uritsky, General Director of BNBC, signed the contract on behalf of their respective organizations at the project site.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as Phase I of Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, the First Stage of a High-Tech Agribusiness Project in Pukhovichi District, the First Stage of the Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, and the Organization high-tech agro-industrial production of complete cycle for 2016 - 2032 (Stage 1) Project. The Russian project title is «Организация высокотехнологичного агропромышленного производства полного цикла на 2016 – 2032 годы» (I этап). The Chinese project title is 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 高科技农工生产项目（二期] or 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 2０1６－２０３２年全循环高科技农工综合体.2. None of the China Eximbank loans that supported this project are included in the China’s Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University's Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020. 3. Some sources claim that Bank of China rather than China Eximbank provided a $50 million USD loan for this project. This issue merits further investigation.4. CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is a special purpose vehicle that is minority-owned by the Government of Belarus. It is a joint venture of the Government of Belarus (a 25% ownership stake), CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. (a 20% ownership stake), COFCO Corporation (a 9% ownership stake), Russian Viren-Invest (a 1% ownership stake). Two Scottish companies (Maxforce LP and Altastar LP) and two companies from the United Arab Emirates (Al Salaam Biotech Investments Ltd and Al Ziad Agro Investments Ltd) collectively hold a 45% ownership stake in BNBC. The Russian name and abbreviation for CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is ЗАО «Белорусская национальная биотехнологическая корпорация» (ЗАО «БНБК»). BNBC's website can be found here: https://bnbc.by/.5. The agro-industrial complex uses modern biotechnology to deeply process the grains of crops, produce irreplaceable amino acids (lysine, tryptophan, etc.), and further produce high-yield and high-tech balanced compound feed and biological activator. The complex consists of a lysine plant with an annual output of 50,000 tons, a tryptophan plant with an annual output of 5,000 tons, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant with an annual output of 1 million tons, an oil crop processing plant with an annual output of 300,000 tons, 600,000-ton silos and grain depots with drying facilities, construction of a grain raw material production base with an annual output of 1 million tons, supporting infrastructure projects, and on-site pipe networks.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project (Linked to Project ID#66526 and #67382)

# Description
On February 11, 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China and Belagroprombank — a state-owned bank in Belarus — signed two loan agreements for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project: an RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 36 TOTAL NO. (641)] and a $50 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement. The GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66525, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. The borrowing terms of the BCL, which is captured via Project ID#67382, are unknown. Then, on June 11, 2018, China Eximbank and Belagroprombank signed an RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 37 TOTAL NO. (642)] for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. The second GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66526, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. Belagroprombank on-lent the proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL to a special purpose vehicle (SPV) called CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC). The proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL were to be used by the ultimate borrower, BNBC, to finance a three-year, $853.19 million (RMB 4.29 billion) engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract between CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC, which was signed on November 26, 2016. The loans appears to be secured by (i.e. collateralized against) cash deposits in escrow accounts (or so-called ‘special accounts’). In November 2021, the Government of Belarus transferred responsibility for the  'special accounts' from Belagroprombank to Belarusbank. The project involved the construction of a new amino acid plant, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant, a grain silo project with drying facilities, a combined heat and power station, and supporting infrastructure (such as railways, highways, natural gas pipelines, and transmission lines) in Pukhovichi District within Minsk Oblast. Upon completion, the agro-industrial complex is expected to process 250,000 tons of grain (wheat/triticale) per year and produce 64,700 tons of lysine, 5,900 tons of L-threonine, 1,300 tons of L-tryptophan, 23,000 tons of gluten, 99,000 tons of lysine-containing feed, 15,000 tons of ammonium sulfate crystals, and 10,000 tons of liquid ammonium sulfate. The project was also expected meet the future needs of cattle breeders for ‘essential amino acids.’ Its products will be sold domestically and abroad. CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on July 27, 2018 and was originally expected to last for 36 months (estimated end date: July 27, 2021). On March 26, 2019, a formal groundbreaking ceremony for the Belarusian agro-industrial complex project took place. By end of 2020, the project had achieved a 73% completion rate. On October 31, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  produced the first batch of lysine sulfate. Then, on November 8, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of first wheat gluten. Then, on December 21, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of threonine. The construction of all Phase 1 and Phase 2 facilities was completed in December 2021 and all facilities were put into operation in November 2022. On August 6, 2020, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a $547 million (RMB 3.8 billion) general EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. A Phase 3 feasibility study was subsequently completed and Phase 2 was approved by a Government of Belarus Commission for Foreign Exchange and Credit. Then, on November 5, 2021,  CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a revised EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project worth RMB 4.8 billion. Yang Jianqiang, Deputy President of CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  and Danil Uritsky, General Director of BNBC, signed the contract on behalf of their respective organizations at the project site.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural and industrial development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of amino acid plant, feed production plant, grain silo, and supporting infrastructure; no mention of renewable energy or energy efficiency components
